node.title: Flawless Ko on fire at LPGA event in Florida, claims early lead
node.description: The Kiwi golfer was in vintage form in her opening round, reeling off a total of nine birdies.
node.content: ["A red-hot Lydia Ko has hurtled to the top of the leaderboard after the opening round of the LPGA event in Florida on Friday (NZ time).", "The Kiwi world No. 1 reeled off a total of nine birdies at the Gainbridge LPGA to finish at nine-under par 63, holding a two-shot lead over second-placed American Danielle Kang.", "Starting on the back nine, Ko began with an ominous birdie, before shooting three-straight from the 13th to the 16th holes, then repeating the feat from the first to the third.", "Coming off the back of her top-10 finish at the season-opening event at her local Lake Nona, the 24-year-old was in vintage form, hitting the green 16 from 18 times in regulation, where she was on fire with her putter.", "More to come"]
